thread.title: High school roundup: Shenendehowa boys' soccer scores playoff win
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Shenendehowa boys' soccer scores playoff win - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: High school roundup: Shenendehowa boys' soccer scores playoff win
text:
Defending Section II Class AA boys' soccer champion and No. 5 seed Shenendehowa advanced to the quarterfinal round with a 4-1 win over No. 12 Albany on Thursday at Shenendehowa High School .
Shenendehowa (12-4) will meet the winner of Friday's first-round game between No. 4 Saratoga Springs and No. 13 La Salle on Monday.
Kyle Pfaff scored a pair of goals and Malik Sykes added a goal and an assist for the Plainsmen.
Joey Peltier scored the goal for the Falcons (4-11-1).
More boys' soccer: Connor Newton and Aaron Muia scored goals as No. 6 Colonie blanked No. 11 Schenectady 2-0 in a Class AA first-round game. The Garnet Raiders (11-5) will meet No. 3 Bethlehem at 3 p.m. Monday. ... No. 13 Corinth advanced on penalty kicks over No. 4 Mekeel Christian Academy in a Class C first-round game. The Tomahawks (7-9-1) will meet No. 5 Greenville on Saturday in quarterfinal play. The Lions finished the season 16-1.
Girls' soccer: Amanda Rice registered a goal and two assists to help No. 7 Guilderland upend No. 10 Albany 5-0 in a Class AA first-round game. Alyssa Kogelmann added a goal and an assist for the Dutchmen (10-6-1). Guilderland will visit No. 2 Niskayuna in a quarterfinal at 3 p.m. Tuesday. Albany finished the season 1-16. ... Kristen Maher scored in the 22nd minute of the first half and the 15th minute of the second half to spark No. 9 Saratoga Catholic to a 2-0 win over No. 8 Mekeel Christian in a Class D playoff game. Karah Colvin and Abbie Mensler combined for seven saves for Saints.
Girls' volleyball: Mary Batkus had 41 assists and eight kills as Ichabod Crane held off Ravena, 25-16, 20-25, 25-22, 19-25, 25-22 to remain undefeated in the Colonial Council . Jordon Dormody added 20 kills and 10 digs and Jill Smaller chipped in with 14 kills and 14 digs for the Riders (16-0). Hailey Irvis had 13 kills and five blocks for the Indians (14-2).
Football: Noah Simmons of Chatham rushed for 119 yards and a touchdown and passed for 126 yards and another score to lead Chatham past Rensselaer 20-8 in a crossover game. ... Moriah running back Collin Harris rushed for 235 yards and three touchdowns in a 34-0 win over Broadalbin-Perth.
